meanings.definition: Too easily achieved or too simplistic
meanings.sent1: The overfacile solution to the math problem was to just guess the answer.
meanings.sent2: She completed the puzzle so quickly that it seemed overfacile for her.
meanings.sent3: His overfacile explanation for being late was that he got lost in his own neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The overfacile reasoning behind her success was that she was born lucky.
meanings.sent5: The overfacile task of coloring within the lines became a breeze for the young artist.

meanings.definition: Done or achieved with excessive ease or without sufficient effort
meanings.sent1: The overfacile victory left the team feeling unsatisfied with their performance.
meanings.sent2: He passed the test without studying, but it was an overfacile accomplishment.
meanings.sent3: Her overfacile excuse for not finishing the project was that her dog ate her homework.
meanings.sent4: The overfacile win in the game made the players question their skills.
meanings.sent5: The overfacile completion of the marathon without training surprised everyone.

meanings.sent1: The overfacile explanation failed to address the complexity of the issue.
meanings.sent2: The overfacile design of the building lacked creativity and depth.
meanings.sent3: His overfacile response to the criticism was to ignore it completely.
meanings.sent4: The overfacile plot of the movie made it predictable and uninteresting.
meanings.sent5: The overfacile solution to the problem overlooked important details.
